com.davidsoergel.trees

Interface RootedPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, HierarchyNode<T,PhylogenyNode<T>>, Iterable<PhylogenyNode<T>>, LengthWeightHierarchyNode<T,PhylogenyNode<T>>, PhylogenyNode<T>, Serializable, TaxonMergingPhylogeny<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SerializableRootedPhylogeny<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRootedPhylogeny, BasicRootedPhylogeny

    public interface RootedPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>
extends PhylogenyNode<T>, TaxonMergingPhylogeny<T>
    A rooted phylogeny with branch lengths and weights. The generic parameter T specifies the type of the node IDs to be used (typically String or Integer); these IDs should be unique.
    Version:
    $Id: RootedPhylogeny.java 344 2009-09-18 22:37:15Z soergel $
    Author:
    David Soergel

      • nearestKnownAncestor

        T nearestKnownAncestor(RootedPhylogeny<T> rootPhylogeny,
                     T leafId)
                                            throws NoSuchNodeException
        Starting from the node identified by the given ID, climbs this tree towards the root until a node is found that is also present in the provided tree. This is used for stitching together two trees, where one (the provided rootPhylogeny) provides the topology nearer the root and another (i.e. this one) provides the topology nearer the leaves.
        Parameters:
        rootPhylogeny - the RootedPhylogeny in which to look for matching nodes
        leafId - the T identifying the starting node
        Returns:
        the T identifying the nearest ancestor of the requested node in this tree which is present in the provided tree
        Throws:
        TreeException - when the requested leafId is not present in this tree, or if none of its ancestors are present in the rootPhylogeny.
        NoSuchNodeException

      • setLeafWeightsRandom

        void setLeafWeightsRandom(com.davidsoergel.stats.ContinuousDistribution1D speciesAbundanceDistribution)
        Assigns random weights to all of the leaf nodes by sampling from the given distribution. After all the weights are sampled, normalizes them to sum to 1.
        Parameters:
        speciesAbundanceDistribution - the ContinuousDistribution1D from which to sample leaf weights.

      • setLeafWeightsUniform

      • extractIntersectionTree

        SerializableRootedPhylogeny<T> extractIntersectionTree(Collection<T> leafValues,
                                                     Collection<T> leafValues1,
                                                     NodeNamer<T> namer)
                                                                            throws TreeException,
                                                                                   NoSuchNodeException
        Builds a new phylogeny by finding all branches that ultimately lead to a least one leaf in each of two sets. The intersection tree contains branches terminating at internal nodes that are common between the two trees, even if there are no leaves in common below that node.

        The weights in the resulting tree are taken from this one. but may not be normalized.

        Parameters:
        leafValues - a Collection of leaf IDs, all of which should be present in this tree
        leafValues1 - another Collection of leaf IDs, all of which should be present in this tree
        Returns:
        the RootedPhylogeny describing the portion of this tree that is in common between the trees specified by the two leaf sets
        Throws:
        TreeException - when anything goes wrong
        NoSuchNodeException

      • mixWith

        BasicRootedPhylogeny<T> mixWith(RootedPhylogeny<T> phylogeny,
                              double mixingProportion)
                                                     throws TreeException
        Builds a new phylogeny by mixing this tree with another one. This is useful when the trees represent communities, in which case the mixed tree represents a literal mixing of the communities. The two trees in question must have been extracted from the same underlying tree (e.g., the tree of life), to guarantee that their topologies are compatible (though of course the weights will differ). The mixing is done at the leaves; the resulting weights are then summed up the tree as usual.
        Parameters:
        phylogeny - the RootedPhylogeny with which to mix this one
        mixingProportion - the double proportion of this tree to use in the mixture; the other tree will be used with (1-mixingProportion)
        Returns:
        the RootedPhylogeny the mixed phylogeny
        Throws:
        TreeException - when the requested proportion is not between 0 and 1, or if the two trees are not derived from the same base tree.

      • smoothWeightsFrom

        void smoothWeightsFrom(RootedPhylogeny<T> otherTree,
                     double smoothingFactor)
                       throws NoSuchNodeException,
                              TreeException
        Assign leaf weights to this tree based on the weights present in the provided tree, smoothed by adding pseudocounts. This is useful to avoid weights of zero, in cases where that would cause division errors and such. The pseudocount is added uniformly to every leaf of this tree, regardless of the tree topology, and whether or not the node has any weight in the other tree. If the other tree assigns weight to nodes that are not present in this tree, those weights are silently ignored. Finally the weights in this tree are normalized and summed up the tree as usual.
        Parameters:
        otherTree - the RootedPhylogeny from which to copy weights
        smoothingFactor - the double pseudocount to add to all leaf weights
        Throws:
        NoSuchNodeException
        TreeException
